newsitem.title: LATVIA: RIGAS KOMMERCBANKA TO ISSUE 3-YEAR BONDS.
newsitem.headline: RIGAS KOMMERCBANKA TO ISSUE 3-YEAR BONDS.

text.p: One of Latvia's leading banks, Rigas kommercbanka, said on Tuesday it will issue three-year bonds worth $20 million and use foreign investment houses to place them with investors.
"Rigas kommercbanka will issue three-year bonds worth $20 million in order to restructure our assets," the bank's spokesman said.
"As our bank works on project financing, we need long-term and cheap resources in order to maintain liquidity," he added.
The bonds will be placed abroad in a closed issue.
The current financial market situation in Latvia and the fact that short-term and one-year deposits constitute the bulk of the bank's portfolio prevents it from borrowing in Latvia, he said.
He refused to specify the time of the issue.
